div.l: And Iohn also now what doo ye here
By god quoth Iohn Symkyn̄ hath no per͗e
Hym byhoueth serve hym self that hath no swayn̄
Or elles he ys a fole as clerkꝭes seyn̄
Our͗e mauncypull y wene wol be dede
So greueth hit hym in body and hede
And þerfor͗e am̄ y come and eke Aleyn̄
To grynde oure corne and bryng hit hom̄e ageyn̄
Y pᵃray you spede us hethen̄ that ye may
Hit schall be don̄ quoth Symkyn̄ by my fay
What woll ye doon̄ while hit ys in hand
By god right by the hoper woll y stond
Quoth Iohn and see how þe corne gooth ynne
Hit sawh y neủer by my fader kynne
How that þe hoper waggeth to and fro
Aleyn̄ answerd Iohn wolt þᵘou soo
Than̄ wol y be benethen̄ by my croun̄
And see how þe mele falleth a doun̄
In to the trough . that schall be my desporte
Quoth Iohn in faith y may ben̄ of yoᵘur sorte
Y am as evel a mylner as are ye
This myller smyled of her nysete
And thoughte alle þis ys don̄ but for a wyle
They wene that none man̄ may hem bygyle
But by my thryfte yet schall y bler͗e her͗e yȝe
For all the sleight of all her philosophy
The mor͗e queynte crekes þat they y they ymake
The more woll y stele when̄ y ytakeytaketake
In stede of flour͗e y woll yeve hēm brenne
The grettest clerkꝭes be not wysest men̄
As som̄etyme to the wolf Thus spake the mar͗e
Of alle hur͗e arte counte y not a tare ·
